Description: Fragment of a clay seal-impression, quite flat but triangular in section, on the rear three small coils of basketry on one side and the other side is flat and shows basketry impressions as well. The fine brown Nile clay shows small inclusions of mica. The object was hardened after excavation. The front part shows two impressions of a scarab-like seal that have been impressed while the clay was still very wet, distorting parts of the impressions. Next to them finger impressions can be seen as well. The seal shows a standing deity (Ptah?) in the lower right part, facing to the left, left of it in the upper part faint traces of two signs, maybe nTr nfr?.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
